feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued September 10 at 2:03AM AKDT until September 10 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 10 AM AKDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to low visibility.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued September 09 at 11:51AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT MONDAY FOR KENAI RIVER NEAR COOPER LANDING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by the Snow Glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...Kenai River near Cooper Landing through Skilak Lake. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Monday.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 11:25AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT MONDAY ALONG KENAI RIVER... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst is expected. * WHERE...Kenai River near below Skilak Lake, including Kenai Keys. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Monday.

entry.summary: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 3:23AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees across south Texas today.
